org.docheinstein.mp3doctor.commons.hierarchy

Class Entry

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.docheinstein.mp3doctor.commons.hierarchy.Entry
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileWrapper
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DEntry, FEntry

    public abstract class Entry
extends java.lang.Object
implements FileWrapper
    Represents an abstract system entry (i.e. a file or a directory). This abstraction can be use for build cache of files, retrieve the underlying file of those, and create the underlying file or directory.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static Logger L 
      protected java.lang.String mEntryName
      Name of the entry.
      protected java.io.File mFile
      Underlying file this entry wraps.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods

      Creates the underlying file this entry wraps.

      Returns the entry name.

    • Field Detail

      • L

        private static final Logger L

      • mEntryName

        protected java.lang.String mEntryName
        Name of the entry.

        This is not the absolute path of the file; it's just the file name or the directory name of the entry.

        The entry name can't be changed after the initialization of the entry.

      • mFile

        protected java.io.File mFile
        Underlying file this entry wraps. This must be initialized with initForParent(File).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entry

        public Entry(java.lang.String entryName)
        Creates an entry for the given entry name.

        This can be used if the hierarchy have to be built and avoids the create a file for each entry.

        Parameters:
        entryName - the file/directory name (not the path, just the name)
        See Also:
        Entry(File)

      • Entry

        public Entry(java.io.File underlyingFile)
        Creates an entry for the given file.

        This can be used if the hierarchy is already built and there is need to load an already known file.

        Parameters:
        underlyingFile - the file
        See Also:
        Entry(String), initForParent(File)

    • Method Detail

      • getEntryName

        public java.lang.String getEntryName()
        Returns the entry name.
        Returns:
        the entry name

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the entry which may be the entry name if this as been built using Entry(String) or the file name if this has been built using Entry(File).
        Returns:
        the name of the entry, not null if this has been properly initialized

      • getWrappedFile

        public java.io.File getWrappedFile()
        Returns the underlying file this entry wraps.
        Specified by:
        getWrappedFile in interface FileWrapper
        Returns:
        the underlying file this entry wraps

      • initForParent

        void initForParent(java.io.File parentFile)
        Initialize the underlying file for the given parent file.

        Note that this is different from Entry(File) since this method init the underlying file using both the parent file and the name entry specified when built with Entry(String), while the constructor that accepts the file directly initializes the underlying file.

        Parameters:
        parentFile - the parent directory that contains this entry

      • create

        public abstract boolean create()
        Creates the underlying file this entry wraps.
        Returns:
        whether the creation has been successful.
